card.list: Returns a card; has many options
card.details:
Provide a card name and I'll return the card's text as well as its picture.
Without a card name, I'll return a random card. You can ask for multiple cards using a semi-colon
You can use ``--type=`` for card type or ``--tribe=`` for a Tribe (no space after the = ).
Additional options are ``--min``, ``--max``, ``--detailed``, ``--text``, ``--stats``, ``--ability``, ``--image``

ability.details: I only show the ability, subtypes, and stats of a card. Equivalent to `!card --ability`

text.details: I'll show all the card information without the card image. Equivalent to `!card --text`

stats.details: I'll only show the stats of a card. Equivalent to `!card --stats`

image.details: I'll only show the card image. Equivalent to `!card --image`

fullart.details:
You provide a card name, I'll look for its full art.
Some pieces have alternative, which you can access via ``--alt`` or ``--alt2``

cutout.details: I'll show you a cutout art of a Creature card

find.list: Returns card names that contain supplied input
find.details: I'll search for card names that contain the letters you provide.

rate.list: I'll rate a Creature based on its stats
rate.details:
I have three methods ``--metal``, ``--king``, or ``--smildon`` (default metal).
--king has additional options:
``--nocheck --noweight`` (this is equivalent to smildon's in percent)
``--pure`` has no weights at all
``--nocheck`` ignores any stat check modifiers
``--noweight`` ignores any comparison between stats (e.g. having 2 max 2 min is worth more than all average)

readthecard.details:
I have discord read the card's ability using text to speech.
Use ``--brainwashed`` for brainwashed text.

sealed.details: Opens specified number of packs from a curated sealed pool

faq.list: Answers to some of the common questions

rule.list: Returns the definition of the rule

documents.list: The important documents. Use any of these commands

rulebook.details:
You can ask for a different different rulebooks. If you don't tell me otherwise, I'll return the equivalent of `!rulebook EN AU`
For a list of all rulebooks I have, type `!rulebook --list`

rulebooks.details: I show a list of rulebooks I have. Equivalent to `!rulebook --list`

cr.details: I'll give you the Comphrensive Rules document, or just the section specified

comprehensive.details: I'll give you the Comphrensive Rules document

errata.details: I'll give you the official errata document

guide.details: It's a player made guide that provides a more thorough explaination of the basic rules

starters.details: I'll provide a list of starter decks. Default are Metal's old recode starter decks, but you can add ``--king`` or ``--ivan`` for different ones.

formats.details: Shows a list of the community formats and their definitions

banlist.list: You can use `!format` for the list of formats
banlist.details:
Ask me about the banlist or why a card is or could be banned `!whyban <card>`.
There are different `!formats` with their own banlists.

whyban.details:
Explains why a card is be banned, or why people think it should be banned.
Some of the cards with serious reasons also have joke reaons why they should be banned ``--joke``

good.list: Returns a list of good cards
good.details:
Asking about good cards? What'cha looking for?
I can give by type, or if you need something more specific: by build point or tribe.
`!good M'arrillian Creatures`
`!good Attacks 1`

decks.list: Sends a list of community curated decks based on user input
decks.details:
Specify a tribe, tier, deck type, keyword, or Creature to search for decks.
You can use `!deck types` to see an explaination on how types are defined.

tier.details: Sends a list of the specific tier decks

tierlist.list: Returns the tierlist. Or acts as an alias to `!decks` if input is provided

lf.list: Adds a specific match making roles

cancel.list: Remove the specified or all matchmaking roles

donate.details: Sends the donation link. Thanks for supporting my development!

collection.details: Sends a link to the collection

portal.details: Sends a link to the portal

recode.details: Sends a link to Chaotic Recode, a video tutorial, or the list of missing cards

forum.details: Sends a link to the forum, or specifically the deck building subforum

agame.details: Sends a list of cards that A-Game considers fun to play with

menu.details: What's on the menu in the Port Court? Let's find out!

order.details: Order's something I have on the menu

cook.details: I'll share you a emoji recipe. Not to be confused with `!order`

language.list: Connect with other players of the same language!
language.details:
I'll add a language role to you if it exists on the sever.
To find out what languages you can join use `!language list`

tribe.list: You can join your favorite tribe (or lack thereof)
tribe.details:
Here are the tribes you can join:
 <:Dan:294942889337683968> Danian, <:Mip:294941790052679690> Mipedian, <:Mar:294942283273601044> M'arrillian, <:OW:294939978897555457> OverWorld, <:UW:294943282943885313> UnderWorld, <:TL:294945357392248833> Tribeless
You can only be loyal to one... but you can always switch.

brainwash.details: Adds the brainwashed role to a user
brainwash.mod: If you mention a user, I'll brainwash that user

color.details: In servers with color roles, I can be used to set colors

never.details: Shows a Chaotic: Now or Never card, or a random one if none specified. Note: I don't have all of the cards.

fan.details: Sends a card from one of our community acclaimed unsets

compliment.details: I'll try to lift your spirits or let me know if there's someone specific you had in mind.

insult.details: I'll cook up a smoldering burn. Let me know if there's someone specific you had in mind.

joke.list: I'll tell you a Chaotic joke

whistle.details: If you're the host of a trivia this signals that the answer period is over

trivia.details: If an existing trivia is not being hosted, you are now a host! Please use again to stop the trivia

answer.details: Message me the answer to a trivia question. When the host whistles, I'll collect all the answers

happy.details: Did I hear that it's someone's birthday?!

watch.details:
You can watch Chaotic in various languages!
If a season number is followed by SD it isn't high definition.
For a list of all episodes I have, type `!watch --list`

perim.list:
Sends the 'Perim Protector' boss sprites.
For all commands related to the scanquest use `!perim help`

map.details: Sends a map of the OverWorld or UnderWorld

help.details:
**Command Help Syntax Explaination**
> < > notate a user input paramater (these are order dependant)
> a parmater in single quotes ' ' means that literal text(s) is required
> a pipe | notates that either option within ' ' or < > can be used
> a paramater in brackets [] means that it is optional
> [] with ellipses ... notates that any number of that paramater can be used
> command options that have -- can be used anywhere within the syntax and are not order dependant

commands.details: This is for when you need help with my help. You might be looking for `!command help`

everything.details: I'll send you every command I can perform besides `!perim` (scanquest) related commands.

rm.list: Removes the last bot message sent in the channel
rm.mod: If a number is provided, this is an alias for `!delete`

delete.details: Deletes the specified number of messages. If a user mention is provided, deletes that many messages from the user instead.

haxxor.details: Resets the bot's card database and restarts the bot

logs.details: Sends a list of bot logs
